meanings.definition: Drink greedily or in large quantities
meanings.sent1: The thirsty dog was swilling water from his bowl.
meanings.sent2: After the race, the runners were swilling down bottles of water.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was swilling his milk so fast, he got a milk mustache.
meanings.sent4: She was swilling knowledge from books like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The river was swilling down the mountain, carrying debris with it.

meanings.definition: To wash or rinse out a container by pouring liquid in and out
meanings.sent1: She was swilling the glass to clean out the remaining juice.
meanings.sent2: The bartender was swilling the cocktail shaker to prepare the next drink.
meanings.sent3: The kids were swilling the buckets to clean them after playing in the sand.
meanings.sent4: The rain was swilling the streets, washing away the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The dishwasher was swilling the plates, making them sparkle.

meanings.definition: To consume alcohol in large quantities
meanings.sent1: At the party, they were swilling beer like there was no tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The sailors were swilling rum to celebrate their successful voyage.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about swilling too much wine at dinner.
meanings.sent4: The students were swilling shots at the bar to unwind after exams.
meanings.sent5: The old friends were swilling memories along with their drinks.
